justification: “Children completed the 10-item Childhood Narcissism Scale (Thomaes et al., 2008), a well-validated method for assessing childhood narcissism…”
“Children completed the 10-item Rosenberg Self-Esteem Scale (Rosenberg, 1965)… with higher scores indicated higher levels self-esteem.”
“Followers reported on their state self-esteem with 3 items from the State Self-Esteem Scale (Thomaes et al., 2010).”

measured_by: Positive and Negative Affect Scale for Children (3 items)
justification: “Followers reported on their positive state affect with 3 items from the Positive and Negative Affect Scale for Children (Laurent et al., 1999).”

measured_by: Children's Rejection Sensitivity Scale (3 items, reverse-coded)
justification: “Followers … felt included by their leader with 3 items from The Children's Rejection Sensitivity Scale (Downey et al., 1998), which were reverse coded so that higher scores indicated higher inclusion.”

measured_by: 4-item leader effectiveness measure (De Hoogh et al., 2005)
justification: “Followers assessed the perceived effectiveness of their leader with a 4-item measure (De Hoogh et al., 2005).”
“Followers rated their future leader preference with 3 items based on the leadership emergence scale (Smith & Foti, 1998).”
“Followers reported on the perceived group cohesion with 3 items from the Group Cohesiveness Scale (O'Reilly et al., 1989; Seashore, 1954).”
“Aggression of each group member was coded by four trained observers based on The Münster Behavior Coding-System (Grünberg et al., 2018; M-BeCoSy).”
“Arrogance of each group member was coded … based on the M-BeCoSy (Grünberg et al., 2018).”
“Two observers independently coded the frequency of exclusion behaviors … from video recordings of the group task. Exclusion involved words or actions used to exclude a group member.”
“Followers reported on the perceived verbal bullying by their leader with 2 items adapted from the Verbal Bullying Scale (Olweus, 1996; Wang et al., 2009).”
“Leaders' exclusion of followers was coded in the same way as for the followers' exclusion of others.”
